revised_title: Reevaluating Caulobacter crescentus Division Cycle and Cell Differentiation
tldr: The author proposes a new view of the Caulobacter crescentus division cycle, suggesting that the cell-cycle-specific protein synthesis and cell differentiation are related to the completion of pole synthesis rather than being cell-cycle-dependent events. This view considers the division cycles of C. crescentus and E. coli as more similar than previously thought, with both cells best described by a linear division pattern.
